item.description:
MindMac 1.9.13: Performance improvements, Llama 3 on Groq and Perplexity

ðŸš€ New

  • Added support for Llama 3 models on Groq and Perplexity.
  • Introduced support for LaTeX formatting.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Optimized overall application performance, including improved scrolling, better handling of long messages, and simplified multi-paragraph selection for copying.
  • Disabled network proxy when using local inference sources such as Ollama, LMStudio, MLX.
  • Transitioned explanatory messages to popover form in specific settings fields.
  • Enhanced user interface for the main message view.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved problems preventing some users from utilizing Claude 3 models on Vertex AI.

MindMac 1.9.11: Document upload capabilities improvements and other fixes

ðŸš€ New

  • Added custom model field for Ollama when creating new endpoint.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Updated model name for Cohere Command R+.
  • Included service logos next to each answer from AI.
  • Enhanced document upload capabilities, specifically for Excel and CSV file formats.
  • More detailed error messages now shown for Vertex Claude 3 models.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved a bug causing crashes during document uploads.
  • Addressed a crash that occurred during the cleanup of conversations for certain users.

MindMac 1.9.8: Search improvement, OpenAI GPT-4-Turbo & Gemini 1.5 Pro for Google Vertex AI

ðŸš€ New

  • Introduced GPT-4-Turbo model from OpenAI.
  • Integrated the Gemini 1.5 Pro model for Vertex AI users.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Enhanced search functionality now allows for content search across all conversations.
  • Updated the MindMac icon in the message view to reflect the icon selected in app settings.

MindMac 1.9.7: Support Brave Search, Cohere Command R & Command R+ models

ðŸš€ New

  • Introduced Command R & Command R+ models for Cohere.
  • Added support for Brave Search for Internet Browsing.
  • Integrated support for KeyMateAI Google Browse Assistant API.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Removed unnecessary quick text shortcuts for accessing prompt template list and occupation list.

MindMac 1.9.5: Support Gemini 1.5 Pro, Gemini Ultra, llama.cpp and other improvements

ðŸš€ New

  • Added native support for llama.cpp.
  • Introduced Gemini 1.5 Pro and Gemini Ultra models.
  • Integrated Anthropic Claude 3 models into Vertex AI.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Implemented cost display for Claude 3 models in stream mode.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved errors occurring when using Claude 3 models.

MindMac 1.9.3: Support Kagi Search, Claude 3 Haiku, Anyscale, MLX and other improvements

ðŸš€ New

  • Added Claude 3 Haiku model.
  • Added support for image upload for Claude 3 models.
  • Implemented support for Anyscale models.
  • Introduced support for Kagi Search, enabling Internet browsing directly from the platform.
  • Added support for MLX. Users can now easily connect to a MindMac by starting an MLX server or PicoMLXServer.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Improved citation in file upload feature.
  • Improved performance when receiving response in stream mode.
  • The model dropdown list has been updated to hide embedding models for a cleaner interface.
  • Modified the default keyboard shortcut to activate "Bring MindMac to front" from Control + Space to Shift + Control + Space.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Enabled plain HTTP connection for local network.
  • The platform now remembers the editing prompt when users switch between conversations.

MindMac 1.9.0: Document upload, Anthropic Claude 3, Mistral Large & Perplexity new models

ðŸš€ New

  • Introduced document upload feature: We're excited to announce the addition of a document upload feature, currently in beta. This allows you to upload files and inquire about their content. It seamlessly supports PDF, plaintext, and some code file formats. Preliminary testing with Microsoft Office files (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) has shown promise, and we encourage you to provide feedback on this functionality.
  • Introduced new Anthropic Claude models: Claude 3 Opus & Claude 3 Sonnet.
  • Rolled out new Perplexity models, including Sonar Small Chat, Sonar Small Online, Sonar Medium Chat, Sonar Medium Online, and Codellama 70B Instruct.
  • Added new Large model from MistralAI, along with updates to existing models.
  • Added native support for Groq service.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Discontinued support for outdated Anthropic Claude and Perplexity models.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Addressed a keyboard shortcut issue where Command + Shift + Enter inadvertently activated Inline mode, despite Shift + Enter being the designated shortcut.
  • Resolved an issue causing poor rendering quality in Internet Browsing results with some OpenAI models, improving the visual experience.
  • Fixed issue with alternating messages when using Perplexity models.

MindMac 1.8.26: Network proxy, some improvements & bug fixes

ðŸš€ New

  • Introduced network proxy setting, allowing configuration of HTTP or SOCKS5 proxy for routing MindMac traffic.
  • Added a new option to enable or disable auto-correction.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Updated the menubar icon for better width conformity.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Addressed a problem where the right sidebar showed blank fields in macOS Ventura 13.
  • Fixed a crash triggered by adjusting the width of the left sidebar in macOS Ventura 13.
  • Corrected an issue where the conversation title was not fully visible in certain situations.
  • Resolved a crash that occurred when an API endpoint was deleted and a new one was added immediately afterward.
  • Solved a problem where GPT4All returned an empty response.

MindMac 1.8.22: Bug fixes

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved crashing problem when attempting to delete user messages or conversations while receiving streaming response.
  • Fixed crashing problem during the cleanup process of conversations when launch the app.
  • Addressed an issue where certain specific cases were causing blank fields to appear on the right sidebar.
  • Fixed a problem where the message view would scroll up and down immediately after completing a streaming response.
  • Corrected an issue where the summary line would display the incorrect context mode when switching between conversation and global profile.

MindMac 1.8.20: Overall app performance improvement & image vision for Ollama LLaVA

ðŸš€ New

  • Enhanced overall app performance to provide a smoother user experience, including improved scrolling, faster search functionality, and seamless conversation switching.
  • Added new OpenAI models: gpt-4-0125-preview, gpt-4-turbo-preview, and gpt-3.5-turbo-0125.
  • Added a new Perplexity model: mixtral-8x7b-instruct.
  • Introduced a quick action Diagram feature, enabling users to generate diagrams swiftly.
  • Modified the left sidebar to remember the last state it was in when reopening the app, ensuring a seamless user experience.
  • Introduced an add button to the left sidebar, which appears when it is narrow, allowing users to create new conversations or folders conveniently.
  • Enabled image vision support for the Ollama LLaVA model, allowing users to upload images and ask something about them using local model via Ollama.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Disabled the unread notification feature by default to prevent unnecessary notifications.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved the issue causing crashes when moving files into folders.

MindMac 1.8.17: Fix crash bug when initializing data at the first launch

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fixed a bug that caused the app to crash for certain users when initializing data during the initial launch.
  • Resolved an issue where incorrect prompt templates and occupations were displayed when switching between default data and user-input data.

MindMac 1.8.15: Quick actions, some improvements and bug fixes

ðŸš€ New

  • Added context setting in the profile.
  • Introduced quick action buttons when starting to type on the prompt editor.
  • Implemented an option to show or hide buttons on the toolbar.
  • Added the functionality to remember the app when opening message content in an external app.
  • Replaced the extra bar on top of the message view with a new status bar at the bottom of the app.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Enabled stream mode by default.
  • Enhanced the user interface for the button list when hovering over a message.
  • Set the conversation profile as the default with the same settings as the global profile when creating a new conversation.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved a crash issue that occurred when deleting conversations from the sidebar.
  • Fixed an issue that displayed the wrong model when switching between API endpoints in the conversation profile.

MindMac 1.8.14: Ollama improvements

âœ¨ Improved

  • Eliminate the need to provide an API key when adding a new Ollama endpoint.
  • Remove Ollama model from the list if it is not running upon refreshing the model list.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fixed a crash issue that occurred when adding new endpoint in several specific cases.

MindMac 1.8.13: Support Together AI, some improvements and bug fixes

ðŸš€ New

  • Introduced support for Together AI.
  • Added an option to toggle the unread notification feature.
  • Included select all and deselect all buttons in the model management view.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Updated OpenAI latest models.
  • Updated Mistral AI logic to align with API changes.
  • Made the width of the right sidebar persistent even after restarting the application.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fixed a crash issue that occurred when adding Ollama as the first API endpoint.
  • Resolved a crash issue that occurred when attempting to open prompts and occupation template lists when the keyboard shortcut was not functioning.

MindMac 1.8.12: Fix Inline & Ollama crash issues

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved a crash issue that occurred when adding new Ollama endpoint.
  • Fixed a bug causing a crash when using Inline mode on several Mac models.

MindMac 1.8.11: Fix Ollama crash issue

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved a crash issue that occurred when adding new Ollama endpoint.

MindMac 1.8.10: Support Ollama

ðŸš€ New

  • Added full support for Ollama. Now you can use Ollama without LiteLLM.

MindMac 1.8.9: Internet Browsing, OctoAI & many more improvements

ðŸš€ New

  • Introduced the Internet Browsing feature, allowing users to access the latest data from the web. This feature is available in both the main chat and Inline mode.
  • Added support for OctoAI.
  • Included additional new models for Anthropic Claude.
  • Implemented the ability to archive conversations. Users can now archive conversations and unarchive them at a later time.
  • Added a feature to change the app icon, giving users the ability to personalize the appearance of the app.
  • Included an option to hide or show the total amount spent, providing flexibility in displaying financial information on the toolbar.
  • Added an option to hide or show the user's prompt templates and occupation templates.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Removed the favorite icon from the toolbar and added it to each row on the sidebar for easier access.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved a crash issue that occurred when regenerating a title from a sidebar row.
  • Fixed a crash issue that occurred when attempting to delete an in-use endpoint for global profile.

MindMac 1.8.8: Update OpenRouter models & clear all chats

ðŸš€ New

  • Added button to clear all chats and folders quickly.
  • Implemented feature to refresh OpenRouter model list.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Improved performance when opening the model list of a specific API endpoint.

MindMac 1.8.7: Introduce Mistral AI & Google Cloud Vertex AI Gemini models

ðŸš€ New

  • Introduced support for Mistral AI models.
  • Added support for Google Cloud Vertex AI Gemini models.
  • Implemented a keyboard shortcut to submit prompts when "Enter to Send" is turned off.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Improved the parameter configuration and logic for Google AI Gemini models.
  • Set a default API endpoint when adding new models.

MindMac 1.8.6: Improve multiturn requests for Google PaLM 2 Gemini models & fix crash bugs

âœ¨ Improved

  • Handled multiturn requests better for Google PaLM 2 Gemini models.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved crashing issue when switching to GPT-4-Vision model in certain scenarios.
  • Resolved crashing issue occurring during the first app launch on specific devices.

MindMac 1.8.5: Support Google PaLM 2 with Gemini models, Google Vertex AI and Cohere models

ðŸš€ New

  • Support Google PaLM 2 with Gemini Pro and Gemini Vision Pro models added.
  • Added support for Google Vertex AI models. Vertex Gemini Pro and Vertex Gemini Vision Pro are coming in next days.
  • Cohere models now supported.
  • Added feature to edit messages.
  • Added feature to fork messages to new conversation

âœ¨ Improved

  • Updated keyboard shortcuts for toolbar buttons.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fixed issue calling wrong API for Azure OpenAI models.
  • Fixed issue showing both main window and settings window when pressing Show Window button on menu bar.

MindMac 1.8.3: Support GPT-4 Vision & delete multiple chats

ðŸš€ New

  • Introducing support for GPT-4 Vision, allowing users to upload images and ask questions.
  • Added support for the DallE3 model for Azure OpenAI.
  • Implemented a feature to multi-select and delete conversations.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Updated Perplexity models.
  • Enhanced the appearance of links in Markdown mode.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved a bug where Inline mode remained active after disabling and rebooting the application.

MindMac 1.8.2: Support Perplexity models & export conversation to PDF/Markdown/ShareGPT

ðŸš€ New

  • Added support for all Perplexity models.
  • Implemented a new feature that allows users to export entire conversation to PDF, Markdown, and ShareGPT.
  • Added full support for LiteLLM API for utilizing Stream mode with Ollama.

MindMac 1.8.0: Support DALLÂ·E models for image generation

ðŸš€ New

  • Now supporting DALLÂ·E 2 and DALLÂ·E 3 models for image generation, with detailed output preferences including quantity, quality, size, and style. Users can also enable auto save to store images permanently, or open generated images quickly in popular photo editors such as Adobe Photoshop or CleanShot X.
  • Introducing the option to collapse long messages for improved readability.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved lag issue when pasting long text and typing in the prompt editor.

MindMac 1.7.9: Support new OpenAI models, option to hide icon from menu bar

ðŸš€ New

  • Integrated new OpenAI & OpenRouter models including gpt-3.5-turbo-1106 and gpt-4-1106-preview.
  • Introduced option to toggle MindMac icon in the menu bar for customizable display.
  • Added option to show window from the menu bar if the option to hide the icon from the dock was selected.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Utilized SettingsLink to display app settings in macOS 14 Sonoma for improved accessibility.

MindMac 1.7.8: Adding model improvement & bug fixes

ðŸš€ New

  • Added feature that allows users to add a custom model for OpenRouter or a fine-tuned model based on gpt-3.5-turbo.
  • Added a toggle button in the toolbar to switch between markdown mode and text mode.
  • Added a button to switch between markdown mode and text mode for each message by hovering on the message.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Improved error handling by displaying clear error messages with detailed information when adding new API endpoints or new models fails.
  • Sorted items in the output preferences picker in ascending order.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fixed an issue where the response sometimes contained weird text chunks when the temperature was set near "More Creative".
  • Fixed an issue where the prompt list would show slowly when typing "/p" in inline mode.

MindMac 1.7.6: Performance improvement & bug fix

âœ¨ Improved

  • Enhanced the overall performance of the application.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved the issue where the copy button was unresponsive when hovering over a message on macOS 14 Sonoma.

MindMac 1.7.5: Output preferences & UI improvements

ðŸš€ New

  • Introduce a new feature that allows users to customize the output preferences for both the global and conversation profiles. This includes the ability to choose the language, tone, style, and format for the responses.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Decrease the minimum width of the sidebar to improve the overall layout.
  • Reduced the margin of the input field for prompts to optimize space usage.
  • Updated the color of the filter and sort buttons for improved visibility and aesthetics.
  • Updated the color of folder and conversation icons for better consistency and visual appeal.
  • Allow users to scroll upwards while receiving responses in stream mode to easily view previous messages. Please notice that macOS 14 Sonoma offers a more enhanced visual experience for scrolling animations compared to its predecessor, macOS 13 Ventura.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved the issue where the text caret would jump to the end when pressing Shift + Enter in the middle of a prompt text, specifically when using the "Enter to Send" feature.
  • Fixed issue where prompt template was not inserted correctly in certain cases. The problem occurred when applying a prompt template once and then removing it using the Cmd + A command. Subsequent attempts to apply the same prompt template were not being recognized.

MindMac 1.7.2: Code block improvements

âœ¨ Improved

  • Enhanced the positioning of the code block copy button.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved the problem where code blocks occasionally display "undefined" for certain languages.

MindMac 1.7.1: Bug fixes

âœ¨ Improved

  • Improved the text color of the "Apply" button in the Prompt list, Occupation list, and Context mode list to enhance visibility and user experience.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fixed the issue causing the application to crash when deleting a conversation using the keyboard shortcut.
  • Resolved the problem with the context popover not remaining open when the context mode was set to either the last or first three messages.

MindMac 1.7.0: New profile feature & bug fixes

ðŸš€ New

  • Added profile feature that allows users to set API parameters globally or by conversation: API provider, model, temperature, topP, topK (for Anthropic Claude), presense penalty, frequency penalty, max tokens.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved the issue of invisible text when editing the Occupations Template and Prompt Template.
  • Fixed the bug where input autofocus was missing when adding a new conversation.

MindMac 1.6.2: Scrolling improvements and bug fixes

âœ¨ Improved

  • Enhanced scrolling effect when receiving stream response.
  • Set default conversation sorting to be by creation date in descending order.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolved issue where questions were being added to the wrong conversation when asked in a newly created conversation.

MindMac 1.6.0: New sidebar & performance improvements

ðŸš€ New

  • Introduced a new sidebar for improved conversation organization.
  • Added support for previous versions of OpenAI models: gpt-3.5-turbo-0301, gpt-4-0314, gpt-4-32k-0314.
  • Implemented the ability to modify the font size of code blocks.

âœ¨ Improved

  • Enhanced overall performance of the application, resolving lag and unresponsiveness problems.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Modified the accessibility permission prompt to only appear during the initial launch of the app.

MindMac 1.5.3: Fix critical crash issue

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fixed a critical crash problem that occurred when sending prompts in version 1.5.1 after upgrading from version 1.4.2 or earlier.

MindMac 1.5.2: Fix critical crash issue

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fixed a critical crash problem that occurred when sending prompts in version 1.5.1 after upgrading from version 1.4.2 or earlier.

MindMac 1.5.1: Support fine-tuned model, model management and some minor fixes

ðŸš€ New

  • Added model management feature, allowing users to choose which models should appear in the toolbar.
  • Added support for fine-tuned models for OpenAI and Azure OpenAI.
  • Fully supported local LLMs through LM Studio or LocalAI.
  • Added a setting option to show/hide the icon in the Dock. This can be found in Settings → Configuration → Others.
  • Added a setting option to show a confirmation dialog when deleting a message. This can be found in Settings → Configuration → Others.
  • Added a setting option to automatically copy the response to the clipboard. This can be found in Settings → Configuration → Others.
  • Added more options for GPT trigger command, prompt trigger command, and Inline setting trigger command.

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Corrected the incorrect model code name for certain models in OpenRouter.

MindMac 1.4.4: Update some minor fixes

âœ¨ Improved

  • Updated code to switch to a different API endpoint if the current one is removed from Settings → Account → API Endpoint & Proxy

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fixed bug that prevented the correct model from being selected after adding a new API endpoint

MindMac 1.4.3: Support OpenRouter and update some minor fixes

ðŸš€ New

  • Added support for OpenRouter service. Users can now add OpenRouter as an API endpoint and utilize its 10 models

âœ¨ Improved

  • Enhanced user experience by remembering the last opened window size and position
  • Made the entire prompt editor tappable for easy focus
  • Trimmed whitespace and newline characters when activating a license by copying the license code
  • Improved UI by bringing back the Delete Conversation button, which was removed in version 1.4.2

MindMac 1.4.2: Hotfix crash issue

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Resolve the problem causing the app to crash upon initial launch

MindMac 1.4.1: Hotfix issue

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fix issue that unable to generate conversation title when stream mode is turned on

MindMac 1.4.0: Anthropic Claude, multiple API endpoints and unread notification

ðŸš€ New

  • Support Anthropic Claude models: Claude Instant and Claude 2
  • Support multiple API endpoints and able to switch between them while chatting. Find more at Settings → Account → API Endpoint & Proxy
  • Add unread notification with indicator in sidebar to monitor unread messages
  • Add hotkeys Option + â†‘ (âŒ¥ â†‘), Option + â†“ ( âŒ¥ â†“) to navigate question history while prompt editor active
  • Add message information. Just hover on message and press information button

âœ¨ Improved

  • Now you don't need to restart MindMac after modifying keyboard shortcuts
  • UI improvements: rearrange the toolbar buttons to improve visual appearance
  • UI improvements: add Stop hotkey text in Inline loading indicator
  • UI improvements: update API adding form and license activation form

ðŸ”§ Fixed

  • Fix issue hotkey Shift + Enter (â‡§ â†µ) cannot be used in other apps while MindMac is in background and Inline mode is off
  • Fix issue app crash when press on submit prompt hotkey while using Inline mode

MindMac 1.0.0: First release of intuitive native macOS app powered by ChatGPT API

ðŸš€ Features

  • Support all ChatGPT models (GPT-3.5, GPT-4)
  • Conversation style control (More Precise or More Creative)
  • Auto generate conversation title - Usage information
  • Light/dark mode
  • Prompt template library
  • Occupation library
  • Hotkey and shortcut
  • Favorite chats
  • Chat history
  • Chat folders
  • Global search

Additional features will be added in the future. Just enjoy the app!
